value.title: AI-Powered Characters Changing The Game
value.excerpt: Gamers have been clamoring for better non-player characters for years, and the arrival of conversational AI may finally provide the computing superpower to make it possible.

value.title: These robot dogs can't bark — but they can speak in full sentences thanks to ChatGPT
value.excerpt: Boston Dynamics' robot dogs can now verbally respond in "plain English" when asked to describe their previous and future tasks.

value.title: Harmonic Drive showcasing latest in advanced motion control at Robotics Summit
value.excerpt: At the Robotics Summit & Expo, Harmonic Drive will showcase its latest motion control technologies and discuss how to simplify the design of a robotic joint.

value.title: These robot arms were designed to help humans interact with AI
value.excerpt: Jizai Arms is a system of supernumerary robotic limbs. Up to six of these arms can be worn and controlled by the user. The limbs allow the wearer to attach, detach, replace or edit the arms. This was designed to enable social interaction between wearers to support human beings acting with robots and AIs while maintaining a sense of self-awareness and widening the possibility of human actions.

value.title: Hollywood screenwriters don’t want robots taking their jobs, either
value.excerpt: The thousands of WGA scribes who went on strike this week are concerned in part about the rise of AI — and how the major studios might tap the technology going forward.

value.title: This Robot Can Paint. But Is It Art?
value.excerpt: Researchers at Carnegie Mellon University developed an A.I.-powered arm that can paint an abstract acrylic. Is it art?

value.title: Stone-hearted researchers gleefully push over adorable soccer-playing robots
value.excerpt: On Wednesday, researchers from DeepMind released a paper ostensibly about using deep reinforcement learning to train miniature humanoid robots in complex movement skills and strategic understanding, resulting in efficient performance in a simulated one-on-one soccer game.

value.title: Mechatronics: Blended Engineering for the Robotic Future
value.excerpt: The term was coined in 1971 by Tetsuro Mori, an engineer at robotics company, Yaskawa Electric Corp. He combined the words "mechanical" and "electronic" to describe the electronic control systems that Yaskawa was building for mechanical factory equipment.
